required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: French Observational Survey to Assess Hypoglycaemia in Insulin-treated Diabetic Patients
clinical_study.official_title: French Observational Survey to Assess Hypoglycaemia in Insulin-treated Diabetic Patients

brief_summary.textblock:
This non-interventional study is conducted in Europe. The study is both retrospective and prospective.
The purpose of the study is to assess the frequency of hypoglycaemia (low blood glucose) in insulin-treated patients with type 1 and type 2 diabetes.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of insulin-treated patients experiencing at least one hypoglycaemia (severe/non-severe)
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the one-month follow-up after inclusion in study

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of insulin-treated patients experiencing at least one severe hypoglycaemia
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the last 12 months before inclusion in study

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of insulin-treated patients experiencing at least one severe hypoglycaemia
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the one-month follow-up after inclusion in study

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of insulin-treated patients experiencing at least one non-severe symptomatic hypoglycaemia
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the one-month follow-up after inclusion in study

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of insulin-treated patients experiencing at least one asymptomatic hypoglycaemia
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the one-month follow-up after inclusion in study

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of insulin-treated patients experiencing at least one hypoglycaemia (overall/severe/non-severe)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the one-month follow-up after inclusion in study

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of episodes (event/patient/month) in insulin-treated patients of severe hypoglycaemia
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the last 12 months before inclusion in study

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of episodes (event/patient/month) in insulin-treated patients of severe hypoglycaemia
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the one-month follow-up after inclusion in study

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of episodes (event/patient/month) in insulin-treated patients of non-severe symptomatic hypoglycaemia episodes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the one-month follow-up after inclusion in study

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of episodes (event/patient/month) in insulin-treated patients of asymptomatic hypoglycaemia episodes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the one-month follow-up after inclusion in study
During the one-month follow-up after inclusion in study

secondary_outcome.measure: Extra diagnostic tests carried out (number of extra self-monitoring plasma glucose (SMPG) test following the episode)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the one-month follow-up after inclusion in study

secondary_outcome.measure: Additional consultations to a specialist and/or general practitioner (GP), visit to emergency department, hospitalizations, transportation and assistance of a care-giver
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the one-month follow-up after inclusion in study

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in planned daily activities; sleep, food consumption, physical activities (sport), driving, social life
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the one-month follow-up after inclusion in study

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in planned daily activities; work: effectiveness, missing hours or days for sick leave
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the one-month follow-up after inclusion in study

intervention.description: Patients will be asked to complete 2 self-assessment questionnaires

study_pop.textblock: Approximately 3811 patients with Type 1 or Type 2 diabetes are expected to be recruited. Patients will be asked to complete 2 self-assessment questionnaires, one retrospective and one prospective, to characterize severe hypoglycaemias during the last 12 months (retrospective questionnaire) and severe/non-severe hypoglycaemias during the coming month after inclusion (prospective questionnaire).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with Type 1 or Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus
- Patients treated by insulin for at least 12 months
- Patients able to perform capillary self-monitoring plasma glucose (SMPG) measurements
- Patients able to complete the questionnaires
- Patients who have accepted to participate to the survey (signature of an information notice)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus not treated with insulin
- Females who are currently pregnant or lactating or who were pregnant during the previous year

results_reference.citation: Cariou B, Fontaine P, Eschwege E, Lièvre M, Gouet D, Huet D, Madani S, Lavigne S, Charbonnel B. Frequency and predictors of confirmed hypoglycaemia in type 1 and insulin-treated type 2 diabetes mellitus patients in a real-life setting: results from the DIALOG study. Diabetes Metab. 2015 Apr;41(2):116-25. doi: 10.1016/j.diabet.2014.10.007. Epub 2014 Nov 24.
